item.title: `fromString`
item.description: fromString # # Converts a string to a boolean. # Returns the boolean of which `s` is a string representation. # The accepted representations are `true`, `false` # (in any combination of lower- and upper-case), # and also `1` for true and `0` for `false`. # This is the inverse of `value:toString` applied to a `boolean`. # # + s - string representing a boolean value # + return - boolean that `s` represents, or an error if there is no such boolean public isolated function fromString(string s) returns boolean|error = external; fromString documentation -  (source : ballerina spec) 1import ballerina/io; 2 3public function main() returns error?
